citation.article-title: Acholeplasma multilocale sp. nov., isolated from a horse and a rabbit.

p.s: Description of Acholeplasma multilocale sp. nov.
Acholeplasma multilocale (mul.ti.lo.ca'le. M.L. gen. multilocale, referring to more than one location)
Pleomorphic cells are bounded by a single unit membrane.
Colonies on agar have a typical fried-egg appearance.
Organisms are filterable through 220-nm-pore-size membrane filters and are resistant to penicillin.
Optimal growth occurs at 35 to 37Â°C under aerobic or anaerobic conditions.
A film is produced on egg yolk agar.
Glucose, fructose, maltose, mannose, and sucrose are metabolized; arginine is hydrolyzed; resazurin, methylene blue, and tellurite are reduced.
The DNA base composition is 31 mol% guanine-plus-cytosine.
Isolated from a horse nasopharynx and rabbit feces.
The type strain is strain PN525 (= NCTC 11723).
